intro: Echium pycnanthum subsp. nanum, commonly known as the dwarf thimbleweed, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, tubular blue or violet flowers. The plant typically produces a basal rosette of narrow, hairy leaves and has a short flowering period in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its botanical features make it an attractive and relatively easy-to-grow plant for rock gardens and native plant collections.
